title: Advance Senior SIGINT Analystt
description: 2011-2013 Advance Collection Team, U.S Army 7th Special Forces Group (A), EGLIN AFB, FL Served as a Senior Signals Intelligence/Electronic Warfare (SIGINT/EW) Cryptologic Linguist and collection equipment operator in the Technical Control and Analysis Element (TCAE) for the 7th Special Forces Group (Airborne) operating in the CENTCOM and SOUTHCOM Areas of Operations; Assists with technical, analytical and linguistic support for 7th Special Forces Group (Airborne) primary areas of operations. - Provided numerous training with peers to ensure they were trained proficiently in tactical ground equipment; UHF/HF/VHF/Wolfhound System/PRD-13 System/DRT1500 box. - Trained with TICOM Geometrics on GEONET software while still in its testing phase and development. - Trained and became qualified on Counter Electronic Warfare Systems during a three week Electronic Warfare Maintainer course.

summary: Active Top Secret/ SCI clearance with HCS/Gamma Provided Through Single Scope Background Investigation (SSBI). I have completed 8 years SIGINT analyst performance in different Areas of Operations. Skilled Intelligence Analyst with Tactical/Strategic organizational, analytical, and training abilities. Provided SIGINT support to Coalition Force elements through 24-hour watch operations. Utilized numerous IC databases and tipping tools to yield a number of reports daily. Experience in OEF extends to; Low Level Voice Interception (LLVI), Signal Terminal Guidance (STG), numerous program and various SIGINT databases search engines and disciplines. Task Force 3-10 Geospatial analysis while assisting the Tactical Screening Facility, ISR support and Air coordinations, Task-Force 3-10 target development. SIGINT analysis stateside as well as leading elements while providing (STG) SIGINT terminal guidance/VHF ground guidance to overseas in a high stress environment. My first deployment, as a SIGINT Analyst, I was the training NCOIC for the foreign soldiers, late comers to the deployment and anyone who needed assistance fixing equipment, configuring databases/or tools, as well as report- writing / Mission tasking / de-tasking priorities, while supporting air assets during combat operations. I was awarded the Army Joint Service Commendation Medal for my work as a Senior SIGINT Analyst, specifically, for providing accurate information during Combat Operations and preventing attacks to Forces. Completed two rotations to Afghanistan (OEF) as a Senior-Level Ground SIGINT Analyst Operator, and Geospatial Analyst for target development in 2009 and 2010. Additionally, I participated in numerous Objectives providing SIGINT/EW support to Task-Force Commander capturing and neutralizing many OBJs while developing new target packages.

title: Senior SIGINT Analyst (Linguist)
company: Senior Cryptologic Linguist, 75th Ranger Regiment, Ft Benning, GA
description: 2009-2011 Senior Cryptologic Linguist, 75th Ranger Regiment, Ft Benning, GA Senior Cryptologic SIGINT Linguist for a globally deployable tactical Operational SIGINT Team (OST) which conducts Signals Intelligence (SIGINT) and Electronic Warfare (EW) operations in support of the 75th Ranger Regiment Special Troops Battalion and the three Ranger Line Battalions; responsible for exploitation and analysis of communication devices; which conducts SIGINT/EW and radio reconnaissance operations in denied, hostile, and politically sensitive areas; responsible for all linguistic duties for languages in Central and South America; responsible for operational training for the CENTCOM areas of Operations. - Received Army impact award for numerous Tactical combat Operation. - Produced numerous SIGINT reports in response to Request for information from Task Force personnel resulting in the detainment of numerous High Value Targets. - Led SIGINT Team in numerous tactical Objectives who... - Worked as the Geospatial SIGINT Analyst Exploitation NCOIC for a Tactical Screening Facility; CELLEX, DOCEX section. - Conducted Task Force SIGINT daily briefings, Analysis, Target Development, Tactical equipment training, and Mission Support during tactical deployment during Operation Enduring Freedom (OEF).

title: Senior SIGINT Analyst (Linguist)
company: Senior SINGT Analyst, 314st Military Intelligence NSA/CSS Texas, Lackland AFB, TX
description: 2006-2009 Senior SINGT Analyst, 314st Military Intelligence NSA/CSS Texas, Lackland AFB, TX Analyst Leader responsible for the accountability, training and professional development of an eight member Analyst Team; Senior SIGINT Analyst responsible for the daily processing of numerous time sensitive transmission in support of national-level priorities in the Western Hemisphere; employs expert technical knowledge in preparing target packages; supports operations in support of Force Protection Operations; lead trainer and target developer for different target set; provides direct input for operational and strategic planning, programming, and recommendations for optimal production within areas of operations. - Trained joint service and civilian linguists in Special Intelligence Processing Applications; resulted in a weekly production increase of over 30%. - Exceeded NSA/CSS mission standard of 80% by scoring 98% on mission certification test.

summary: Active Top Secret/ SCI clearance with HCS/Gamma Provided Through Single Scope Background Investigation (SSBI). I have completed 8 years SIGINT analyst performance in different Areas of Operations. Skilled Intelligence Analyst with Tactical/Strategic organizational, analytical, and training abilities. Provided SIGINT support to Coalition Force elements through 24-hour watch operations. Utilized numerous IC databases and tipping tools to yield a number of reports daily. Experience in OEF extends to; Low Level Voice Interception (LLVI), Signal Terminal Guidance (STG), numerous program and various SIGINT databases search engines and disciplines. Task Force 3-10 Geospatial analysis while assisting the Tactical Screening Facility, ISR support and Air coordinations, Task-Force 3-10 target development. SIGINT analysis stateside as well as leading elements while providing (STG) SIGINT terminal guidance/VHF ground guidance to overseas in a high stress environment. My first deployment, as a SIGINT Analyst, I was the training NCOIC for the foreign soldiers, late comers to the deployment and anyone who needed assistance fixing equipment, configuring databases/or tools, as well as report- writing / Mission tasking / de-tasking priorities, while supporting air assets during combat operations. I was awarded the Army Joint Service Commendation Medal for my work as a Senior SIGINT Analyst, specifically, for providing accurate information during Combat Operations and preventing attacks to Forces. Completed two rotations to Afghanistan (OEF) as a Senior-Level Ground SIGINT Analyst Operator, and Geospatial Analyst for target development in 2009 and 2010. Additionally, I participated in numerous Objectives providing SIGINT/EW support to Task-Force Commander capturing and neutralizing many OBJs while developing new target packages.

title: Senior SIGINT Analyst (Linguist)
description: 2007-2008 Host Nation SIGINT Officer, overseas Lead a joint staff of multiple personnel on assignment to National Security Agency/Central Security Service(NSA/CSS); manages the functioning and effective use of multiple transcription and reporting positions; performs target identification and implementation of collection; supervises the quality control, analysis, timely submission and rapid dissemination of critical intelligence; ensure the timely update of numerous databases that are used to effectively identify, develop, and exploit targets to support the warfighter. - Led a team of analyst who directed the neutralization of two high ranking terrorist group officials. - Disseminated numerous intelligence reports; reducing armed conflicts for numerous Force Protection Support. - Regarded by host nation Commander as a competent and trustworthy ambassador. - Maintained SIGINT communications and automation equipment valued in over hundreds of dollars.

title: President
description: O-MC Signal Research, Inc. is a Vietnam era veteran-owned small business located in Bloomfield, New Jersey, just ten miles west of Manhattan. Our core business base is wireless in-building design, development, and installation. The company was founded in 1988. Initially, our business focus was the defense industry where we bid and won two Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) contracts in the area of Quantum Cryptography. Our primary business base today is the design and development of in-building systems for enhaced wireless phone service using GSM, CDMA, or iDEN waveforms, and high-speed networks using IEEE 802.11 a,b,g,&n technologies. We also design and install wireless broadband networks to replace standard T-1 wired circuits. In March of 2005 the company was awareded a three-year contract by the state of New Jersey Bureau of Purchase for Wireless Devices and Services. This contract has been extended to the end of 2008.

summary: Manager of Communications Engineering Projects: 1. As the Director of RF Engineering from 1996 to 2001 I led the original team that built the GSM Mobile Phone network for the New York Major Trading Area (NYMTA). This network is now operated by T-Mobile. 2. For the defense industry; won and completed a phase I and a phase II Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) contract for the U.S. Navy's Space and Naval Warfare Command. Topic of the research was Quantum Cryptography. A U.S. patent was awared in 2001 for this work. 3. Defense industry expertise is in the areas of spread spectrum intercept techniques (SIGINT, ELINT, ESM), and receiver design. 4. Technical areas of concentration are communications theory and signal processing.

summary: Manager of Communications Engineering Projects: 1. As the Director of RF Engineering from 1996 to 2001 I led the original team that built the GSM Mobile Phone network for the New York Major Trading Area (NYMTA). This network is now operated by T-Mobile. 2. For the defense industry; won and completed a phase I and a phase II Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) contract for the U.S. Navy's Space and Naval Warfare Command. Topic of the research was Quantum Cryptography. A U.S. patent was awared in 2001 for this work. 3. Defense industry expertise is in the areas of spread spectrum intercept techniques (SIGINT, ELINT, ESM), and receiver design. 4. Technical areas of concentration are communications theory and signal processing.

title: SOT-A Team Member
description: - conduct SIGINT/EW operations in support of US Army SOCOM and JSOC missions, often operating in remote and denied areas - detect, monitor, and exploit threat communications through communications transmission intercept and direction finding - support SF ODAs with limited interrogation, translation, interpretation, and communications support. - deploy with, or independently in support of, SF ODAs to provide contingency, direct action, force protection, or MTT support - operate and train on advanced collection equipment provided by national intelligence agencies - train in tactical and fieldcraft techniques, infiltration and extraction techniques, and are certified in the same basic skills as SF ODAs, in addition to linguistic, International Morse Code (IMC), and SIGINT skills

title: Warrant Officer / 351M (Arabic / Farsi)
description: Interrogates and debriefs as defined by regulation, the UCMJ, and other applicable regulations and agreements. Conducts and supervises both tactical and strategic interrogation related duties, to include Military Source Operations (MSO). Supervises the technical performance of subordinate military and civilian personnel in related job skills. Develops and approves interrogation plans and missions. Advise the support element on the best employment of HUMINT Collector assets. Coordinates closely with other intelligence and non-intelligence agencies of interrogation and MSO. Writes, reviews, and approves interrogation and Intelligence reports and limited technical intelligence reports.

summary: I am proven leader, who works very well in both a structured / regimented environment as well as in a solo capacity. Even as a Project Manager, I retain the ability to remain focused to the “Team Oriented” concept. I am a proven problem solver and I think very well under pressure. Due to my diversity, I possess very strong communication skills, both direct and interpersonal. I have the ability to travel as needed, fitting well into any environment. I understand the difference between Supervision and Management, always leading by example. 27 years of Military experience, both Active Duty as well as Reserve. Career emphasis most recently, has been holding a direct leadership position, serving as the Chief Instructor for the Florida Counterdrug Program, Law Enforcement Training Mission, mentoring junior level instructors, providing quality control on classes, developing new curriculum and providing cutting edge tactical training to Local, State and Federal Law Enforcement Agencies. Currently sworn as a certified Law Enforcement Officer in the State of Florida, serving as the departmental Lead Training Officer, in a part-time capacity. I have served in the past as a Criminal Intelligence Analyst for the Florida Counterdrug Program, and have extensive experience in Counter Threat Financing, Narco-Terrorism Threat Analysis and multiple disciplines within this arena. Proven communicator, proven leader under stress. Military experience centered around the Tactical Signal Intelligence (SIGINT) arena assigned to US Army Special Operations as a Special Operations Team - Alpha (SOT-A) Team Member / Team Sergeant, progressing to Tactical Human Intelligence (HUMINT) / Source Operations. Multiple deployments in both theaters of operations, as well as other areas of interest, working daily in chosen Military Occupational Specialty (MOS).

title: Owner / Operator / Founder
description: Ranger Proof Arms, LLC is a small, custom shop... Type 07 FFL (Manufacturer). Small. Exclusive. Approachable. I treat each client as a member of the family, direct, one on one communication to fit the needs and budget of every customer. I have a standard rifle, that is spec'd out with everything needed in a hard use rifle, based on my own experiences. The fact that I am small, can be a benefit in terms of custom specifications. Using my input and experience within the industry, Ranger Proof Arms, LLC has aligned with some of the best names out there. This allows the best possible products to be brought to the end user. 100% satisfaction guaranteed. As the business grows, so will options and exclusive offers. www.rangerproof.com

summary: I am proven leader, who works very well in both a structured / regimented environment as well as in a solo capacity. Even as a Project Manager, I retain the ability to remain focused to the “Team Oriented” concept. I am a proven problem solver and I think very well under pressure. Due to my diversity, I possess very strong communication skills, both direct and interpersonal. I have the ability to travel as needed, fitting well into any environment. I understand the difference between Supervision and Management, always leading by example. 27 years of Military experience, both Active Duty as well as Reserve. Career emphasis most recently, has been holding a direct leadership position, serving as the Chief Instructor for the Florida Counterdrug Program, Law Enforcement Training Mission, mentoring junior level instructors, providing quality control on classes, developing new curriculum and providing cutting edge tactical training to Local, State and Federal Law Enforcement Agencies. Currently sworn as a certified Law Enforcement Officer in the State of Florida, serving as the departmental Lead Training Officer, in a part-time capacity. I have served in the past as a Criminal Intelligence Analyst for the Florida Counterdrug Program, and have extensive experience in Counter Threat Financing, Narco-Terrorism Threat Analysis and multiple disciplines within this arena. Proven communicator, proven leader under stress. Military experience centered around the Tactical Signal Intelligence (SIGINT) arena assigned to US Army Special Operations as a Special Operations Team - Alpha (SOT-A) Team Member / Team Sergeant, progressing to Tactical Human Intelligence (HUMINT) / Source Operations. Multiple deployments in both theaters of operations, as well as other areas of interest, working daily in chosen Military Occupational Specialty (MOS).

title: Owner / Founder
description: Ranger Proof Consulting has been an outlet for me to showcase certain tactical gear and tactical tools for use in Military and Law Enforcement duty. By using equipment in a "hard use", realistic environment, I am able to see what works and what does not work for specific mission requirements. I do not just evaluate gear based on limited use, I use this gear as it is intended, over a long period of time. If the piece of gear meets my high standards of performance, then I will deem it "Ranger Proof" and be able to recommend the equipment to the end user. Due to my involvement with Local, State and Federal Law Enforcement Agencies, I have the ability to guide individuals as well as departments in gear selection as it fits their needs. By tapping into the Social Media world, I have been able to establish myself as an end user, with knowledge and history, so that when I recommend or endorse a product, the consumer can rest assured that either I have, or those I trust have used it to its limit and found that it does what it advertises. I have partnered with many companies in the firearms / tactical industry, to test and evaluate their product lines in a very hard use setting. Feedback is given, along with Social Media coverage to increase product awareness and branding. The following list are companies that I have done extensive work with: • Primary Weapons Systems (PWS) • CMC Triggers • Alamo Four Star • GPI Manufacturing • Azimuth Technologies • US Optics • Bushnell Elite • War Sport Industries • Odin Works • Stark Equipment • Delta P Design • LeHigh Defense • GemTech • Diamondback Tactical • GreyFox Industries • Skallywag Tactical

title: 1SG
description: Served as the 1SG (First Sergeant) for Delta Company (Anti-Armor) of the 1st Battalion, 124th Infantry (Florida Army National Guard). As the Senior NCO (Non Commissioned Officer) I assisted the Company Commander and Executive Officer in direct management and supervision of all service members in the company. I oversaw and carried out all aspects of training, making sure that the company was in a high state of readiness should a deployment or a call up to State Active Duty occur.

title: Chief Law Enforcement Instructor - Florida Counterdrug Program
description: Chief Law Enforcement Instructor / Program Manager for the Law Enforcement Training Mission for the Florida Counterdrug Program, providing world class, tuition free training to Local, State, and Federal law enforcement agencies. As the Chief Instructor, I would oversee and manage a team of Instructors, mentor the team through instructor development, and ensure that all courses are up to date and relevant. Live fire training (Pistol, Rifle, Shotgun, Precision Rifle) as well as Force on Force scenarios with Simmunition / UTM helps Tactical Teams stay on the cutting edge within their scope of duty. As the Program Manager, I supervised and mentored six full time Law Enforcement Instructors, developed class curriculum and POI, vetted POI and assured quality control. Instructor development was key to my leadership model. Travel and expense sheets were also my responsibility.

summary: I am proven leader, who works very well in both a structured / regimented environment as well as in a solo capacity. Even as a Project Manager, I retain the ability to remain focused to the “Team Oriented” concept. I am a proven problem solver and I think very well under pressure. Due to my diversity, I possess very strong communication skills, both direct and interpersonal. I have the ability to travel as needed, fitting well into any environment. I understand the difference between Supervision and Management, always leading by example. 27 years of Military experience, both Active Duty as well as Reserve. Career emphasis most recently, has been holding a direct leadership position, serving as the Chief Instructor for the Florida Counterdrug Program, Law Enforcement Training Mission, mentoring junior level instructors, providing quality control on classes, developing new curriculum and providing cutting edge tactical training to Local, State and Federal Law Enforcement Agencies. Currently sworn as a certified Law Enforcement Officer in the State of Florida, serving as the departmental Lead Training Officer, in a part-time capacity. I have served in the past as a Criminal Intelligence Analyst for the Florida Counterdrug Program, and have extensive experience in Counter Threat Financing, Narco-Terrorism Threat Analysis and multiple disciplines within this arena. Proven communicator, proven leader under stress. Military experience centered around the Tactical Signal Intelligence (SIGINT) arena assigned to US Army Special Operations as a Special Operations Team - Alpha (SOT-A) Team Member / Team Sergeant, progressing to Tactical Human Intelligence (HUMINT) / Source Operations. Multiple deployments in both theaters of operations, as well as other areas of interest, working daily in chosen Military Occupational Specialty (MOS).

title: 1SG

I directly assisted the Company Commander and the Executive Officer in direct management and supervision of all service members in the company. It was my duty to oversee and carry out all aspects of training, making sure that the company was in a high state of readiness should a deployment or a call up for State Active Duty occur. I also assisted in all BN Operations, directly reporting to the BN CSM and maintained tight logistical support for the other companies in the BN.

title: HUMINT Platoon Sergeant (PSG)
description: I served as the Tactical Human Intelligence (TAC HUMINT) Platoon Sergeant for A Co. 260th Military Intelligence Battalion (Linguist). As the Platoon Sergeant, I was responsible for the training and mentor-ship of the TAC HUMINT Collection Teams (THT's). All personnel issues that had to be taken care of within my platoon were handled by me, and I answered directly to the TAC HUMINT Platoon Leader and the Company First Sergeant. During my tenure as PSG, I deployed twice into combat operations as a Human Intelligence Collector / Arabic Linguist / Interrogator.

Career emphasis most recently, has been holding a direct leadership position, serving as the Chief Instructor for the Florida Counterdrug Program, Law Enforcement Training Mission, mentoring junior level instructors, providing quality control on classes, developing new curriculum and providing cutting edge tactical training to Local, State and Federal Law Enforcement Agencies. Currently sworn as a certified Law Enforcement Officer in the State of Florida, serving as the departmental Lead Training Officer, in a part-time capacity. I have served in the past as a Criminal Intelligence Analyst for the Florida Counterdrug Program, and have extensive experience in Counter Threat Financing, Narco-Terrorism Threat Analysis and multiple disciplines within this arena. Proven communicator, proven leader under stress. Military experience centered around the Tactical Signal Intelligence (SIGINT) arena assigned to US Army Special Operations as a Special Operations Team - Alpha (SOT-A) Team Member / Team Sergeant, progressing to Tactical Human Intelligence (HUMINT) / Source Operations. Multiple deployments in both theaters of operations, as well as other areas of interest, working daily in chosen Military Occupational Specialty (MOS).

title: Operational Management Team Chief
description: As a Senior Level Human Intelligence Collector (HUMINT) I was activated and assigned to the 56th Stryker Brigade Combat Team and deployed to Camp Taji, Iraq. During my attachment to the 2/104th Cavalry, I served as the Operational Management Team Chief (OMT) and supervised four, four-man Human Intelligence Collection Teams. These teams were stationed at Joint Support Sites throughout our operational area. My scope of duty included many areas of influence. I supervised and mentored the junior collectors, aiding and guiding in collection focus, interrogation strategies, questioning plans, and force multipliers to the Combatant Commanders. I also was able to handle Source Operations on and around Camp Taji. My Arabic language capabilities, allowed me to be assigned as additional duties, to the Squadron Commander, and accompany him to Key Leader Engagement Meetings. I worked hand in hand with a Language Assistant, developing questioning strategies, interrogations, and source assessment. My position also required me to manage all contingency fund reports submitted by the Collection Teams, as well as quality control on all field reporting that the Collection Teams submitted.

title: Criminal Intelligence Analyst / Seaport Inspector
description: I joined the Florida Counterdrug Program in March of 2001. I was assigned as a Criminal Intelligence Analyst at the South Florida HIDTA (High Intensity Drug Trafficking Area) Intelligence Center in Miramar, FL. My duties included Tactical Photo Line Ups, Financial Background Investigations, Link Analysis, Pen Link Analysis, Surveillance with the host Law Enforcement Agency, and also tenure on the Florida Seaport Inspection Team. During this time, I became certified through the US Merchant Marine Academy as a Deep Water Seaport Inspector, for Threat Vulnerability Assessments, and worked hand in hand with the Florida Department of Law Enforcement (FDLE) in conducting threat assessments on seaports in Florida, post 9-11. During this time, I worked closely with Narco-Terrorism Task Forces to provide direct Counter-Threat Financing Analysis and association matrices.

title: CIVPOL Liaison
description: As a Senior Human Intelligence (HUMINT) Collector, I was tasked to the 192nd MP BN on Camp Bondsteel during Kosovo Force (KFOR) Rotation 5B. I was responsible as the Non-Commissioned Officer in Charge (NCOIC) of the Civilian Police (CIVPOL) Liaison to assist with planning, coordination and liaison between the Military Police, Civilian Police, Ground Unit Commanders and the Military Intelligence (HUMINT) Task Force on Camp Bondsteel, Kosovo. I was responsible for information sharing, intelligence oversight for the KFOR (Kosovo Force) and Regional Commanders. Through this assignment, I was able to successfully meld reporting requirements and collection requirements from the Military side, successfully translating and transferring to the Civilian side. Cross talk between the two task forces yeilding impressive results in the overall mission. My attachment to this Joint Law Enforcement Liaison Task Force allowed me freedom of movement to conduct my mission in a permissive environment.

I have served in the past as a Criminal Intelligence Analyst for the Florida Counterdrug Program, and have extensive experience in Counter Threat Financing, Narco-Terrorism Threat Analysis and multiple disciplines within this arena. Proven communicator, proven leader under stress. Military experience centered around the Tactical Signal Intelligence (SIGINT) arena assigned to US Army Special Operations as a Special Operations Team - Alpha (SOT-A) Team Member / Team Sergeant, progressing to Tactical Human Intelligence (HUMINT) / Source Operations. Multiple deployments in both theaters of operations, as well as other areas of interest, working daily in chosen Military Occupational Specialty (MOS).

title: SOT-A Team Sergeant
description: Ranger qualified team Sergeant for a Special Operations Team - Alpha (SOT-A) Voice Intercept Team in the Florida Army National Guard. Military Intelligence rating as well as a Top Secret security clearance was held during this tenure. My duties included, force protection, electronic interception / direction finding, low level voice intercept, cellular phone methodology and intercept techniques, tactical special operations (waterborne, airborne and long range land operations), Advanced Collection Techniques, Geo-Locating, Cellular Exploitation using CELLEBRITE. Responsible for over $800,000 worth of communications equipment and sensitive cryptographic items as well as supervising four other team members. During my tenure, I deployed to Afghanistan with Support Company, 3rd Battalion, 20th Special Forces Group (Airborne) in support of Operation Enduring Freedom and served as a SOT-A Team Sergeant during combat operations. I was directly attached to Task Force 11 early on, then to Operational Detachment - Alpha (ODA) 361 and ODA 362 in a non-permissive, hostile environment to carry out unilateral and joint Signals Intelligence Missions. Proven, effective leader during austere conditions and high tempo environment.

summary: SERVICE INTELLIGENCE ADVANCED GROUP Staffed by personnel of elite military, security and civil backgrounds.Service Intelligence Advanced Group Officers conduct intelligence operations under tactical and non-tactical conditions in multiple environments; detect, monitor and exploit threat communications through communications transmission intercept and direction finding; and collect positive intelligence information against local terrorists, insurgents, activists, criminal organizations and personnel, and other hostile elements and activities that may pose a threat to United States interests. In addition to their linguistic, international Morse code (IMC), HUMINT and SIGINT skills; we are trained in tactical and field-craft techniques and are certified in advanced military skills. “Certified Fraud Examiner” (CFE), a Certified Security Consultant (CSC) from the International Institute Of Security & Safety Management, IISSM, a “Certified Fraud Consultant” (CFC) from the International Fraud Training Institute a “Fellow” (FACFE) & “Diplomat” (DABFE) of The American College of Forensic Examiners. and certification in “Homeland Security” Level III – CHSIII. Our purpose is to offer governments and other legitimate organizations specialist military expertise an provide active support to friendly governments & to support them in conflict resolution, has materially decreased,s has their capability to do so. Securing strategic assets –water,food,electricity key installations,Convoy escort Air support,Marine support we can assist in non conflict support to law and order, typical areas include, but are not restricted to Counter -narcotics/Counter- terrorism Protection of key installations Revenue/Fisheries protection/maritime surveillance Operations support we can provide specialist in Command,control communication teams Special forces/Maritime/sub sea special warfare units Pilots

title: CEO-Instructor
description: Our creed is based on a high definition integrated competence by the versatility of skills acquired through our training continuously updated through classes in basic and advanced, to meet the most demanding needs of the ever-changing environment. If you as a new bodyguard want to assure yourself some advantages in the competition for the available jobs. The only options you have, are through quality training and education, therefore we have focus on capacity-building, preventive measures and effective protection of client and personal safety during our courses and educations. We teach only the techniques and tactics that we know from our own experience works, which means that our subjects are relevant, realistic, and give you the essential knowledge and abilities of being able to deliver professional close protection. Our commitment is to provide you all the tools you need to succeed in a challenging career with good wage return. The choice is yours ... In addition to their linguistic, international Morse code (IMC), HUMINT and SIGINT skills; we are trained in tactical and field-craft techniques and are certified in advanced military skills. “Certified Fraud Examiner” (CFE), a Certified Security Consultant (CSC) from the International Institute Of Security & Safety Management, IISSM, a “Certified Fraud Consultant” (CFC) from the International Fraud Training Institute a “Fellow” (FACFE) & “Diplomat” (DABFE) of The American College of Forensic Examiners. and certification in “Homeland Security” Level III – CHSIII. Our purpose is to offer governments and other legitimate organizations specialist military expertise an provide active support to friendly governments & to support them in conflict resolution, has materially decreased,s has their capability to do so. Securing strategic assets –water,food,electricity key installations,Convoy escort Air support,Marine support we can assist in non conflict support to law and order, typical areas include, but are not restricted to Counter -narcotics/Counter- terrorism Protection of key installations Revenue/Fisheries protection/maritime surveillance Operations support we can provide specialist in Command,control communication teams Special forces/Maritime/sub sea special warfare units Pilots

title: Witness protection specialist
description: My work experience includes: Project manager, responsible for ensuring that all security projects and programs are properly planned, managed, resourced and governed and that all necessary project controls and standards are in place, enabling timely delivery and completion of the project within budget and specification. Conducting security risk and threat assessments, crime reduction surveys and advising stockholders on the most appropriate methods to protect the organization. Providing specific crime prevention design advice at the planning stage of a building project and ensuring that the appropriate security and all appropriate counter terrorism features are incorporated into the design specifications. Prevention and detection of security breaches and incidents and the creation of a pro security culture. Investigating all instances of violence towards staff, working with the Police and the Crown Prosecution Service and taking the most appropriate action through either the criminal justice process or the civil courts.

title: Commanding Officer
description: Instructed junior pilots in all facets of large multi-engine aircraft operations to include crew resource management, emergency procedures, and basic Special Response Team skills. Mission Commander - Led, planned, managed, and executed assignments to Asset Protection crew and Securing Strategic Assets: Water, Food, Electricity and Key Installations at the highest levels of readiness. Squadron Scheduler - Scheduled daily flight operations in order to meet the individual training requirements of ten independently deployed crews consisting of 196 aircrew personnel. Program Manager - Managed and analyzed data that tracked and correlated Counter Narcotic hours expended as related to each individual's qualifications. Reported the efficiency of squadron Command, Control, Communication, and Intelligence Teams hours utilized to accomplish training objectives and identified inefficiencies in Tactical Field training as well as expired qualifications. Implementation of program allowed squadron to achieve the highest readiness levels at a reduced cost in Training hours. Training Officer - Developed and implemented monthly training plans for continuing professional education of all Special Forces Unit assigned

summary: SERVICE INTELLIGENCE ADVANCED GROUP Staffed by personnel of elite military, security and civil backgrounds.Service Intelligence Advanced Group Officers conduct intelligence operations under tactical and non-tactical conditions in multiple environments; detect, monitor and exploit threat communications through communications transmission intercept and direction finding; and collect positive intelligence information against local terrorists, insurgents, activists, criminal organizations and personnel, and other hostile elements and activities that may pose a threat to United States interests. In addition to their linguistic, international Morse code (IMC), HUMINT and SIGINT skills; we are trained in tactical and field-craft techniques and are certified in advanced military skills. “Certified Fraud Examiner” (CFE), a Certified Security Consultant (CSC) from the International Institute Of Security & Safety Management, IISSM, a “Certified Fraud Consultant” (CFC) from the International Fraud Training Institute a “Fellow” (FACFE) & “Diplomat” (DABFE) of The American College of Forensic Examiners. and certification in “Homeland Security” Level III – CHSIII. Our purpose is to offer governments and other legitimate organizations specialist military expertise an provide active support to friendly governments & to support them in conflict resolution, has materially decreased,s has their capability to do so. Securing strategic assets –water,food,electricity key installations,Convoy escort Air support,Marine support we can assist in non conflict support to law and order, typical areas include, but are not restricted to Counter -narcotics/Counter- terrorism Protection of key installations Revenue/Fisheries protection/maritime surveillance Operations support we can provide specialist in Command,control communication teams Special forces/Maritime/sub sea special warfare units Pilots

description: Managed daily operations of a $1 million foam insulation company. Developed an effective Strategic, Operational and Tactical Planning. Implemented Operational Research Analysis more Project Estimate accurate bids. Allowed for the tracking of individual job costs and provided feedback as to efficiency of crews with regards to material waste and labor hours. Trained and supervised work crews in more efficient product installation techniques that have reduced material waste by 20% and labor hours by 43%. Developed Private Security Contractor team's knowledge in the areas of building Security Operations and Tactical Security conservation in order to provide customers with the Personal Security to successfully plan for their Assets Protection.

title: Instructor
description: Instructed junior pilots in all facets of large multi-engine aircraft operations to include crew resource management, emergency procedures, and basic Special Response Team skills. Mission Commander - Led, planned, managed, and executed assignments to Asset Protection crew and Securing Strategic Assets: Water, Food, Electricity and Key Installations at the highest levels of readiness. Squadron Scheduler - Scheduled daily flight operations in order to meet the individual training requirements of ten independently deployed crews consisting of 196 aircrew personnel. Program Manager - Managed and analyzed data that tracked and correlated Counter Narcotic hours expended as related to each individual's qualifications. Reported the efficiency of squadron Command, Control, Communication, and Intelligence Teams hours utilized to accomplish training objectives and identified inefficiencies in Tactical Field training as well as expired qualifications. Implementation of program allowed squadron to achieve the highest readiness levels at a reduced cost in Training hours. Training Officer - Developed and implemented monthly training plans for continuing professional education of all Special Forces Unit assigned

summary: Highly motivated and decorated Department of the Army Intelligence Analyst with an active TS-SCI security clearance. Has an extensive background covering conventional forces in the pacific, non-state actors in the Middle East, and conventional ground forces in Eastern Europe and former Soviet bloc countries. Trained and proficient in advanced research and analysis including palantir, DCGS-A, Boolean logic and C2PC. Working knowledge of SIGINT, HUMINT, ELINT, MASINT, and IMINT and detainee operations. Secondary specialities include Anti-terrorism officer, physical security specialist, and personnel security.

summary: Highly motivated and decorated Department of the Army Intelligence Analyst with an active TS-SCI security clearance. Has an extensive background covering conventional forces in the pacific, non-state actors in the Middle East, and conventional ground forces in Eastern Europe and former Soviet bloc countries. Trained and proficient in advanced research and analysis including palantir, DCGS-A, Boolean logic and C2PC. Working knowledge of SIGINT, HUMINT, ELINT, MASINT, and IMINT and detainee operations. Secondary specialities include Anti-terrorism officer, physical security specialist, and personnel security.

title: Intelligence Fusion Analyst
description: • Managed 3x military multi-INT analysts supporting the production of the Daily Intelligence summary. • Mentored 3x Civilian Analysts in all-source operations. • Created from scratch and maintained Link Diagrams using HUMINT, COMINT and other sources. • Second in charge behind the NCOIC, responsible for ensuring work and personnel actions were completed on schedule. • Created the daily Graphic Intelligence Summary of the Squadron’s AO which encompassed 2,700 square kilometers. • Squadron LNO with United Kingdom regular troops and Special Forces who operated on the borders and in the AO.

title: Company Intelligence Support NCOIC
description: • Sole Squadron intelligence member responsible for Maiwand district with no supervision. • Coordinated outside entities to maximize force protection including counterintelligence, Human Intelligence Collectors, Low Level Voice Intercept and Special Forces Units. • One of two Army members certified to run the Persistent Ground Surveillance System at the FOB. • Documented patterns of life to target INS personalities. • Responsible for Intelligence Preparation of the Battlefield for all K Troop operations.

description: • Maintained personnel security and training requirements. • Coordinated with the Army Central Clearance Facility for security investigations. • Troop Personnel recovery manager. • Trained 25x team leaders in real world intelligence during a team leaders development course. • Assisted in writing the COIST class curriculum, which was recognized as the top in the Regiment by the European Foundry Platform.

description: • Prepared weekly International Intelligence summary for the BDE leadership. • Brigade security manager entrusted with identifying personnel with derogatory remarks to leadership to make decisions surrounding their Security Clearance. • Maintained personnel records and accountability for over 2000 personnel’s security clearances and reinvestigation requirements. • Maintained the Brigade wide Security Clearance Access Roster (SCAR). • Received and processed incoming derogatory statements.

title: Theater Internment Facility (TIF) Senior Analyst
description: • NCOIC over S2 evaluations responsible for screening over 3000 DETS and provided assessments directly impacting the transition of the TIF to custody of the Afghan government. • Senior analyst responsible with minimal oversight for 6 teams of Analysts and HUMINT collectors totaling over 31 personnel at the TIF. • Maintained databases and products containing demographics for over 4000 detainees. • Provided analysis to support outside entities source directed requirements. • Assessed incoming detainee threat level and assigned detainees in general population to promote a compliant, safe environment for Guard Force. • Worked in cooperation with the Theater Intelligence Group, Strategic Debriefing Center and National agencies on sensitive products. • Responsible for introducing the non-lethal Targeting process, a first for the facility.

summary: SERVICE INTELLIGENCE ADVANCED GROUP Staffed by personnel of elite military, security and civil backgrounds.Service Intelligence Advanced Group Officers conduct intelligence operations under tactical and non-tactical conditions in multiple environments; detect, monitor and exploit threat communications through communications transmission intercept and direction finding; and collect positive intelligence information against local terrorists, insurgents, activists, criminal organizations and personnel, and other hostile elements and activities that may pose a threat to United States interests. In addition to their linguistic, international Morse code (IMC), HUMINT and SIGINT skills; we are trained in tactical and field-craft techniques and are certified in advanced military skills. “Certified Fraud Examiner” (CFE), a Certified Security Consultant (CSC) from the International Institute Of Security & Safety Management, IISSM, a “Certified Fraud Consultant” (CFC) from the International Fraud Training Institute a “Fellow” (FACFE) & “Diplomat” (DABFE) of The American College of Forensic Examiners. and certification in “Homeland Security” Level III – CHSIII. Our purpose is to offer governments and other legitimate organizations specialist military expertise an provide active support to friendly governments & to support them in conflict resolution, has materially decreased,s has their capability to do so. Securing strategic assets –water,food,electricity key installations,Convoy escort Air support,Marine support we can assist in non conflict support to law and order, typical areas include, but are not restricted to Counter -narcotics/Counter- terrorism Protection of key installations Revenue/Fisheries protection/maritime surveillance Operations support we can provide specialist in Command,control communication teams Special forces/Maritime/sub sea special warfare units Pilots

title: CEO-Instructor
description: Our creed is based on a high definition integrated competence by the versatility of skills acquired through our training continuously updated through classes in basic and advanced, to meet the most demanding needs of the ever-changing environment. If you as a new bodyguard want to assure yourself some advantages in the competition for the available jobs. The only options you have, are through quality training and education, therefore we have focus on capacity-building, preventive measures and effective protection of client and personal safety during our courses and educations. We teach only the techniques and tactics that we know from our own experience works, which means that our subjects are relevant, realistic, and give you the essential knowledge and abilities of being able to deliver professional close protection. Our commitment is to provide you all the tools you need to succeed in a challenging career with good wage return. The choice is yours ... summary: SERVICE INTELLIGENCE ADVANCED GROUP Staffed by personnel of elite military, security and civil backgrounds.Service Intelligence Advanced Group Officers conduct intelligence operations under tactical and non-tactical conditions in multiple environments; detect, monitor and exploit threat communications through communications transmission intercept and direction finding; and collect positive intelligence information against local terrorists, insurgents, activists, criminal organizations and personnel, and other hostile elements and activities that may pose a threat to United States interests. In addition to their linguistic, international Morse code (IMC), HUMINT and SIGINT skills; we are trained in tactical and field-craft techniques and are certified in advanced military skills. “Certified Fraud Examiner” (CFE), a Certified Security Consultant (CSC) from the International Institute Of Security & Safety Management, IISSM, a “Certified Fraud Consultant” (CFC) from the International Fraud Training Institute a “Fellow” (FACFE) & “Diplomat” (DABFE) of The American College of Forensic Examiners. and certification in “Homeland Security” Level III – CHSIII. Our purpose is to offer governments and other legitimate organizations specialist military expertise an provide active support to friendly governments & to support them in conflict resolution, has materially decreased,s has their capability to do so. Securing strategic assets –water,food,electricity key installations,Convoy escort Air support,Marine support we can assist in non conflict support to law and order, typical areas include, but are not restricted to Counter -narcotics/Counter- terrorism Protection of key installations Revenue/Fisheries protection/maritime surveillance Operations support we can provide specialist in Command,control communication teams Special forces/Maritime/sub sea special warfare units Pilots

title: Witness protection specialist
description: My work experience includes: Project manager, responsible for ensuring that all security projects and programs are properly planned, managed, resourced and governed and that all necessary project controls and standards are in place, enabling timely delivery and completion of the project within budget and specification. Conducting security risk and threat assessments, crime reduction surveys and advising stockholders on the most appropriate methods to protect the organization. Providing specific crime prevention design advice at the planning stage of a building project and ensuring that the appropriate security and all appropriate counter terrorism features are incorporated into the design specifications. Prevention and detection of security breaches and incidents and the creation of a pro security culture. Investigating all instances of violence towards staff, working with the Police and the Crown Prosecution Service and taking the most appropriate action through either the criminal justice process or the civil courts.

title: Commanding Officer
description: Instructed junior pilots in all facets of large multi-engine aircraft operations to include crew resource management, emergency procedures, and basic Special Response Team skills. Mission Commander - Led, planned, managed, and executed assignments to Asset Protection crew and Securing Strategic Assets: Water, Food, Electricity and Key Installations at the highest levels of readiness. Squadron Scheduler - Scheduled daily flight operations in order to meet the individual training requirements of ten independently deployed crews consisting of 196 aircrew personnel. Program Manager - Managed and analyzed data that tracked and correlated Counter Narcotic hours expended as related to each individual's qualifications. Reported the efficiency of squadron Command, Control, Communication, and Intelligence Teams hours utilized to accomplish training objectives and identified inefficiencies in Tactical Field training as well as expired qualifications. Implementation of program allowed squadron to achieve the highest readiness levels at a reduced cost in Training hours. Training Officer - Developed and implemented monthly training plans for continuing professional education of all Special Forces Unit assigned

Our purpose is to offer governments and other legitimate organizations specialist military expertise an provide active support to friendly governments & to support them in conflict resolution, has materially decreased,s has their capability to do so. Securing strategic assets –water,food,electricity key installations,Convoy escort Air support,Marine support we can assist in non conflict support to law and order, typical areas include, but are not restricted to Counter -narcotics/Counter- terrorism Protection of key installations Revenue/Fisheries protection/maritime surveillance Operations support we can provide specialist in Command,control communication teams Special forces/Maritime/sub sea special warfare units Pilots

title: CEO & General Manager
description: Managed daily operations of a $1 million foam insulation company. Developed an effective Strategic, Operational and Tactical Planning. Implemented Operational Research Analysis more Project Estimate accurate bids. Allowed for the tracking of individual job costs and provided feedback as to efficiency of crews with regards to material waste and labor hours. Trained and supervised work crews in more efficient product installation techniques that have reduced material waste by 20% and labor hours by 43%. Developed Private Security Contractor team's knowledge in the areas of building Security Operations and Tactical Security conservation in order to provide customers with the Personal Security to successfully plan for their Assets Protection.

title: Instructor
description: Instructed junior pilots in all facets of large multi-engine aircraft operations to include crew resource management, emergency procedures, and basic Special Response Team skills. Mission Commander - Led, planned, managed, and executed assignments to Asset Protection crew and Securing Strategic Assets: Water, Food, Electricity and Key Installations at the highest levels of readiness. Squadron Scheduler - Scheduled daily flight operations in order to meet the individual training requirements of ten independently deployed crews consisting of 196 aircrew personnel. Program Manager - Managed and analyzed data that tracked and correlated Counter Narcotic hours expended as related to each individual's qualifications. Reported the efficiency of squadron Command, Control, Communication, and Intelligence Teams hours utilized to accomplish training objectives and identified inefficiencies in Tactical Field training as well as expired qualifications. Implementation of program allowed squadron to achieve the highest readiness levels at a reduced cost in Training hours. Training Officer - Developed and implemented monthly training plans for continuing professional education of all Special Forces Unit assigned

summary: SERVICE INTELLIGENCE ADVANCED GROUP Staffed by personnel of elite military, security and civil backgrounds.Service Intelligence Advanced Group Officers conduct intelligence operations under tactical and non-tactical conditions in multiple environments; detect, monitor and exploit threat communications through communications transmission intercept and direction finding; and collect positive intelligence information against local terrorists, insurgents, activists, criminal organizations and personnel, and other hostile elements and activities that may pose a threat to United States interests. In addition to their linguistic, international Morse code (IMC), HUMINT and SIGINT skills; we are trained in tactical and field-craft techniques and are certified in advanced military skills. “Certified Fraud Examiner” (CFE), a Certified Security Consultant (CSC) from the International Institute Of Security & Safety Management, IISSM, a “Certified Fraud Consultant” (CFC) from the International Fraud Training Institute a “Fellow” (FACFE) & “Diplomat” (DABFE) of The American College of Forensic Examiners. and certification in “Homeland Security” Level III – CHSIII. Our purpose is to offer governments and other legitimate organizations specialist military expertise an provide active support to friendly governments & to support them in conflict resolution, has materially decreased,s has their capability to do so. Securing strategic assets –water,food,electricity key installations,Convoy escort Air support,Marine support we can assist in non conflict support to law and order, typical areas include, but are not restricted to Counter -narcotics/Counter- terrorism Protection of key installations Revenue/Fisheries protection/maritime surveillance Operations support we can provide specialist in Command,control communication teams Special forces/Maritime/sub sea special warfare units Pilots

title: CEO-Instructor
description: Our creed is based on a high definition integrated competence by the versatility of skills acquired through our training continuously updated through classes in basic and advanced, to meet the most demanding needs of the ever-changing environment. If you as a new bodyguard want to assure yourself some advantages in the competition for the available jobs. The only options you have, are through quality training and education, therefore we have focus on capacity-building, preventive measures and effective protection of client and personal safety during our courses and educations. We teach only the techniques and tactics that we know from our own experience works, which means that our subjects are relevant, realistic, and give you the essential knowledge and abilities of being able to deliver professional close protection. Our commitment is to provide you all the tools you need to succeed in a challenging career with good wage return. The choice is yours ... Advanced Sniper Specialist Basic and advanced tri-service general military training Special forces , Psy –ops and intelligence training Police unit training EOD, IEDD and Landmine clearance training Counter insurgency operations training Critical Threat Intervention Close protection training Counter terrorist and anti-assassination team training Diplomatic Security Training High Risk Protection Security Ofiicer Training Security Officer Armed Surveillance and Intelligence OPS Private Detective Training Loss Prevention Training BodyGuard Training Executive Protection Training Advanced Executive Protection Training Counter Terrorist Crisis Management Maritime Security Training Military Mobile Force Protection Fugitive Recovery – Bail Enforcement Training Curriculum Counter Assault Operatiions Military Mobile Force Protection Woman’s Defensive Handgun

title: Witness protection specialist
description: My work experience includes: Project manager, responsible for ensuring that all security projects and programs are properly planned, managed, resourced and governed and that all necessary project controls and standards are in place, enabling timely delivery and completion of the project within budget and specification. Conducting security risk and threat assessments, crime reduction surveys and advising stockholders on the most appropriate methods to protect the organization. Providing specific crime prevention design advice at the planning stage of a building project and ensuring that the appropriate security and all appropriate counter terrorism features are incorporated into the design specifications. Prevention and detection of security breaches and incidents and the creation of a pro security culture. Investigating all instances of violence towards staff, working with the Police and the Crown Prosecution Service and taking the most appropriate action through either the criminal justice process or the civil courts.

summary: SERVICE INTELLIGENCE ADVANCED GROUP Staffed by personnel of elite military, security and civil backgrounds.Service Intelligence Advanced Group Officers conduct intelligence operations under tactical and non-tactical conditions in multiple environments; detect, monitor and exploit threat communications through communications transmission intercept and direction finding; and collect positive intelligence information against local terrorists, insurgents, activists, criminal organizations and personnel, and other hostile elements and activities that may pose a threat to United States interests. In addition to their linguistic, international Morse code (IMC), HUMINT and SIGINT skills; we are trained in tactical and field-craft techniques and are certified in advanced military skills. “Certified Fraud Examiner” (CFE), a Certified Security Consultant (CSC) from the International Institute Of Security & Safety Management, IISSM, a “Certified Fraud Consultant” (CFC) from the International Fraud Training Institute a “Fellow” (FACFE) & “Diplomat” (DABFE) of The American College of Forensic Examiners. and certification in “Homeland Security” Level III – CHSIII. Our purpose is to offer governments and other legitimate organizations specialist military expertise an provide active support to friendly governments & to support them in conflict resolution, has materially decreased,s has their capability to do so. Securing strategic assets –water,food,electricity key installations,Convoy escort Air support,Marine support we can assist in non conflict support to law and order, typical areas include, but are not restricted to Counter -narcotics/Counter- terrorism Protection of key installations Revenue/Fisheries protection/maritime surveillance Operations support we can provide specialist in Command,control communication teams Special forces/Maritime/sub sea special warfare units Pilots

title: Commanding Officer
description: Instructed junior pilots in all facets of large multi-engine aircraft operations to include crew resource management, emergency procedures, and basic Special Response Team skills. Mission Commander - Led, planned, managed, and executed assignments to Asset Protection crew and Securing Strategic Assets: Water, Food, Electricity and Key Installations at the highest levels of readiness. Squadron Scheduler - Scheduled daily flight operations in order to meet the individual training requirements of ten independently deployed crews consisting of 196 aircrew personnel. Program Manager - Managed and analyzed data that tracked and correlated Counter Narcotic hours expended as related to each individual's qualifications. Reported the efficiency of squadron Command, Control, Communication, and Intelligence Teams hours utilized to accomplish training objectives and identified inefficiencies in Tactical Field training as well as expired qualifications. Implementation of program allowed squadron to achieve the highest readiness levels at a reduced cost in Training hours. Training Officer - Developed and implemented monthly training plans for continuing professional education of all Special Forces Unit assigned

title: CEO & General Manager
description: Managed daily operations of a $1 million foam insulation company. Developed an effective Strategic, Operational and Tactical Planning. Implemented Operational Research Analysis more Project Estimate accurate bids. Allowed for the tracking of individual job costs and provided feedback as to efficiency of crews with regards to material waste and labor hours. Trained and supervised work crews in more efficient product installation techniques that have reduced material waste by 20% and labor hours by 43%. Developed Private Security Contractor team's knowledge in the areas of building Security Operations and Tactical Security conservation in order to provide customers with the Personal Security to successfully plan for their Assets Protection.

Mission Commander - Led, planned, managed, and executed assignments to Asset Protection crew and Securing Strategic Assets: Water, Food, Electricity and Key Installations at the highest levels of readiness. Squadron Scheduler - Scheduled daily flight operations in order to meet the individual training requirements of ten independently deployed crews consisting of 196 aircrew personnel. Program Manager - Managed and analyzed data that tracked and correlated Counter Narcotic hours expended as related to each individual's qualifications. Reported the efficiency of squadron Command, Control, Communication, and Intelligence Teams hours utilized to accomplish training objectives and identified inefficiencies in Tactical Field training as well as expired qualifications. Implementation of program allowed squadron to achieve the highest readiness levels at a reduced cost in Training hours. Training Officer - Developed and implemented monthly training plans for continuing professional education of all Special Forces Unit assigned

summary: SERVICE INTELLIGENCE ADVANCED GROUP Staffed by personnel of elite military, security and civil backgrounds.Service Intelligence Advanced Group Officers conduct intelligence operations under tactical and non-tactical conditions in multiple environments; detect, monitor and exploit threat communications through communications transmission intercept and direction finding; and collect positive intelligence information against local terrorists, insurgents, activists, criminal organizations and personnel, and other hostile elements and activities that may pose a threat to United States interests. In addition to their linguistic, international Morse code (IMC), HUMINT and SIGINT skills; we are trained in tactical and field-craft techniques and are certified in advanced military skills. “Certified Fraud Examiner” (CFE), a Certified Security Consultant (CSC) from the International Institute Of Security & Safety Management, IISSM, a “Certified Fraud Consultant” (CFC) from the International Fraud Training Institute a “Fellow” (FACFE) & “Diplomat” (DABFE) of The American College of Forensic Examiners. and certification in “Homeland Security” Level III – CHSIII. Our purpose is to offer governments and other legitimate organizations specialist military expertise an provide active support to friendly governments & to support them in conflict resolution, has materially decreased,s has their capability to do so. title: Special Forces Communications Sergeant
description: Duties: Proven proficiency with A+, NET+, and computer applications concepts, basic radio and antenna theory, radio wave propagation, basic electricity, radio telephone procedures, signal-operating instructions, communications security, power applications, field expedient antennas, and information operations/electronic warfare as they pertain to a Special Forces Communications Sergeant as well as communications procedures, radio systems, and techniques for the proper use of the FM, AM, HF, VHF, and UHF spectrums. Trained on radios and radio-secure systems common to the US Army such as the AN/PRC-148, AN/PRC 119F, AN/PRC117G, AN/PRC 150, AN/PYQ-10, and the AN/CYZ-10; also familiar with clandestine radio systems such as the PRC-137. Well versed in satellite theory, the use of satellite radios, demand assigned multiple access (DAMA) and point to point operations. Trained in the use of multiple computer applications such as PDA-184, Mover, and Tac-Chat to install, operate, and maintain satellite communications link. Qualifications: Employs conventional and unconventional warfare tactics and techniques in providing communications training and support during unilateral, combined, coalition, joint, interagency and multinational operations; recruits and organizes indigenous forces. Trains, advises, and supervises the installation and operation of radios, communications procedures, facsimile, wire communications, and computer networks in Army Special Forces units up to battalion level. Trained, advised, and supervised the installation and operation of radio systems, communications procedures, and computer networks in Army Special Forces units from the team to the company level. Employs Special Operations communications equipment to include HF, VHF, and UHF/SHF radio communications systems to transmit and receive radio messages in voice, continuous wave, and burst radio nets.

title: Cryptic Linguist, Special Operations Team Alpha - Team Member
description: Duties: Served on a four man Special Operations Team Alpha while stationed at 5th SFG (A), Fort Campbell, KY. Duties and Responsibilities: Identify foreign communications from an assigned geographic area and categorizing signals by activity type. Analyze foreign communication for information to support mission reporting requirements. Recognize changes in transmission modes and tipping the appropriate analytical or intercept authority. Provide translation expertise to analysts. Operate systems as needed to support Signals Intelligence tasking, reporting, and coordination. Provided gists, transcriptions, and translations of foreign communications. Qualifications: The cryptologic communications interceptor/locator performs and supervises the detection, acquisition, location, identification, and exploitation of foreign communications at all echelons using signals intelligence/electronic warfare (SIGINT/EW) collection and location systems. The cryptologic communications interceptor/locator copies, translates, transcribes, gists or produces summaries of foreign communication transmissions. Performs collection management as needed to support mission requirements.

title: Visual Information Equipment Operator/Maintainer
description: Duties: Performed duties as the Electronic Maintenance Technician for the Army’s only active duty Combat Camera Signal Company which deploys worldwide in support of missions mandated by the Office of the Secretary of Defense, the Joint Chiefs of Staff, and the Department of the Army. Responsible for the individual training, professional development, and health and welfare of subordinate soldiers. Participated in humanitarian service missions in support of Hurricane Rita/Katrina. Led over 30 Joint Force - Canadian and American troops while at Field Training Exercise Southbound Trooper. Deployed as a Combat Camera/Videographer in support of Operation Enduring Freedom VII in 2006. While deployed participated in numerous operations and task force missions leading to over 500 images and more than 5 hours of video footage for the purpose of intelligence and historical documentation which lead to numerous awards and accommodations. Qualifications: Installs, operates, maintains and performs unit and higher levels of maintenance on visual information equipment and systems, to include Video Teleconferencing VI equipment, television receivers/monitors and cameras; studio accessories consisting of computer controlled video switchers and audio mixers/consoles, synchronous generators, distribution equipment, and amplifying equipment; motion/still photo imaging equipment; closed circuit systems; visual imagery satellite, microwave, RF transmission and cable distribution systems associated with VI operations in support of Army, Joint, and Combined operations.

summary: Christopher Berger is the Director of Staff, 24th Special Operations Wing, Air Force Special Operations Command, Hurlburt Field, Fla. The 24 SOW is comprised of two Special Tactics groups and a training squadron with more than 1,400 assigned special operations Battlefield Airmen and combat support personnel. Mr. Berger graduated from Drexel University, and received his commission from Saint Joseph’s University as an Air Force ROTC distinguished graduate. In 1992, he attended the Air Force Fighter Weapons School, Nellis AFB, Nev., where he was the Command and Control Division’s Outstanding Graduate. He has served in a variety of roles that included chief of weapons and tactics, director of operations, branch chief, and deputy commander positions. Mr. Berger is a seasoned combat Master Air Battle Manager with more than 4,500 hours in the E-3A/B/C AWACS as a weapons controller, senior director, mission crew commander, instructor, and evaluator. CAREER CHRONOLOGY 1987 - 1993, 552 ACW, E-3 AWACS Weapons Director, Instructor Weapons Director, Senior Director, Instructor Senior Director, Chief Weapons and Tactics, Tinker AFB, OK 1993 - 1996, 18 WG, E-3 AWACS Evaluator Senior Director, Chief Weapons and Tactics, 18 OSS, Kadena Air Base, Japan 1996 - 1998, 505 CCEG/C2TIG, Chief, Tactics Development and Evaluation, Commander Tactics and Reconnaissance Flight, Assistant Director of Operations, Eglin AFB and Hurlburt Field, FL 1998 - 2000, ACC/DOY, Chief, Ground C2 Branch, Langley AFB, VA 2000 - 2003, 552 ACW: Chief Wing Plans, AWACS Mission Crew Commander, Operations Support Squadron Director of Operations, Tinker AFB, OK 2003 - 2006, Headquarters Air Force, AF/A3OY, Chief Air and Space Operations Center Branch, Deputy Director, C2 Battle Management Division, Pentagon, Washington, D.C. 2006 - 2012, 505 CCW Director of Staff, Hurlburt Field, FL 2012 - Present, 24th Special Operations Wing, Director Staff, Hurlburt Field, FL

title: Director of Staff
description: Proficiently directed a 50 person Wing Staff and the Commander’s Action Group in order to enhance warfighter capability through C2 testing, tactics development and training. Applied expert knowledge of management, planning, policies and practices, regulations, and laws associated with the organization’s structure and mission. Directed enterprise strategic planning and continuous process improvement. Developed, advocated and justified Program Objective Memorandum (POM) proposals and other major programs verbally and in writing. Handled the format and content of wing staff meetings and oversaw the wing scheduling function, aligning COMACC-directed training and exercises to meet requirements. Supervised, mentored, motivated, coached, appraised, and collaborated with section leads, supervisors and their subordinate employees in the accomplishment of day-to-day operations. Key Highlights: - Led wing contracting office and played a role of a Project Lead for the wings contract consolidation effort, valued at over $200M and reduced cost of doing business by $6M/year. - Orchestrated executive leadership and guidance for all staff areas of responsibility including manpower, personnel, financial management, civil engineering, contracting, plans and programs, public affairs, history, and the Wing Graphics function. - Seamlessly supported three groups, eight squadrons, three Detachments, and five Operating Locations across the US with 1000+ personnel, 1600+ trainees per year and a $90M+ budget.

title: Chief, Air and Space Operations Center Branch
description: Functionally managed the Air and Space Operations Center weapon system for the Command and Control (C2) Battle Management Operations Division, under the Directorate of Operations and Training and the Deputy Chief of Staff, Air and Space Operations, Headquarters Air Force, Pentagon, Washington DC. Conducted policy and oversight of operational readiness, C2, aircrew management, flying training, civil aviation liaison, special operations and personnel recovery, classified programs, flight standards, airspace, ranges, weather and airfield operations. Evaluated regional combatant commander concepts of operations (CONOPS) for integration and employment of C2 and battle management systems. Guided on operations employment, training, standardization and evaluation of Air and Space Operations Centers, Air Force Forces Staff operations and the Joint Force Air Component Commander. Air Force Crisis Action Team member. Responded and provided support in the aftermath of Hurricane Katrina. Key Highlights: - Championed the identification of challenges and proposed solutions for the Air and Space Operations Center in combat, contingency operations, and exercises. Prepared transformational weapon system concepts and presented to the Chief of Staff of the Air Force. - Delivered executive leadership and guidance as Functional Area Manager responsible for all AOC units and for operational integration of US Air Force's AOC Weapon System. - Chaired Joint and USAF working groups chartered to ensure Joint Air Operations issues are addressed in the development, integration, testing and employment of C2 systems.

title: Director of Operations
description: Successfully managed operations activity for USAF's fleet of 28 E-3 aircraft and nine simulators. Innovatively developed and implemented C2 testing, integration, and tactics. Effectively coordinated with ACC, NAF, ANG, AFRC, NORAD Air Defense Sectors, and Joint services for mission essential fighter weapons resources, data link, and tankers. Authored the wing’s daily flying schedule and executed schedule via real-time monitoring of missions and re-tasking of training events as required. Effortlessly maintained combat mission ready status as E-3 Mission Crew Commander. Designed training programs and managed contracts to train over 1,800 USAF and Canadian Forces personnel. Key Highlights: - Played an integral role as the Director of Operations responsible for managing the operations activity for Air Combat Command's CONUS fleet of 28 aircraft and integrating multiple live radar feeds into the Wing’s Mission Simulator Live Intercept Training Environment (MSLITE) system. - Strategically programmed and analyzed operations to maximize sortie effectiveness, provided intelligence, planning and execution elements for Combined Joint Chiefs of Staff-directed air operations worldwide. - Functioned as a primary coordinator between 552 ACW flying squadrons and the 552d Aircraft Generation Squadron.

summary: Christopher Berger is the Director of Staff, 24th Special Operations Wing, Air Force Special Operations Command, Hurlburt Field, Fla. The 24 SOW is comprised of two Special Tactics groups and a training squadron with more than 1,400 assigned special operations Battlefield Airmen and combat support personnel. Mr. Berger graduated from Drexel University, and received his commission from Saint Joseph’s University as an Air Force ROTC distinguished graduate. In 1992, he attended the Air Force Fighter Weapons School, Nellis AFB, Nev., where he was the Command and Control Division’s Outstanding Graduate. He has served in a variety of roles that included chief of weapons and tactics, director of operations, branch chief, and deputy commander positions. Mr. Berger is a seasoned combat Master Air Battle Manager with more than 4,500 hours in the E-3A/B/C AWACS as a weapons controller, senior director, mission crew commander, instructor, and evaluator. CAREER CHRONOLOGY 1987 - 1993, 552 ACW, E-3 AWACS Weapons Director, Instructor Weapons Director, Senior Director, Instructor Senior Director, Chief Weapons and Tactics, Tinker AFB, OK 1993 - 1996, 18 WG, E-3 AWACS Evaluator Senior Director, Chief Weapons and Tactics, 18 OSS, Kadena Air Base, Japan 1996 - 1998, 505 CCEG/C2TIG, Chief, Tactics Development and Evaluation, Commander Tactics and Reconnaissance Flight, Assistant Director of Operations, Eglin AFB and Hurlburt Field, FL 1998 - 2000, ACC/DOY, Chief, Ground C2 Branch, Langley AFB, VA 2000 - 2003, 552 ACW: Chief Wing Plans, AWACS Mission Crew Commander, Operations Support Squadron Director of Operations, Tinker AFB, OK 2003 - 2006, Headquarters Air Force, AF/A3OY, Chief Air and Space Operations Center Branch, Deputy Director, C2 Battle Management Division, Pentagon, Washington, D.C. 2006 - 2012, 505 CCW Director of Staff, Hurlburt Field, FL 2012 - Present, 24th Special Operations Wing, Director Staff, Hurlburt Field, FL
